Evaluation_Test_Type: All Valid: Forecast Test
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on interval
General_Description: This test case describes when  dose #4 of DTaP is administered at least 4 months -4 days from Dose #3 that the dose is considered to be valid.

Evaluation_Test_Type: Interval: Below Absolute Minimum
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on interval
General_Description: This test case describes when  dose #4 of DTaP is administered at least 4 months -5 days from Dose #3 that the dose is not valid.

Evaluation_Test_Type: All Valid: Forecast Test
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on interval
General_Description: This test case describes when a patient receives Tdap as the decennial dose, that the dose is considered to be valid and another dose should be forecast.

Evaluation_Test_Type: No doses administered
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on age
General_Description: This test case describes when a patient has no previous doses of the tetanus, diphtheria, or pertussis vaccines, that the first dose should be forecast.

Evaluation_Test_Type: All Valid: Forecast Test
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on minimum interval from previous dose (catch-up)
General_Description: This test case describes when a patient has received the first dose of the DTaP/Tdap/Td vaccine that another dose should be forecast.

Evaluation_Test_Type: All Valid: Forecast Test
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on interval
General_Description: This test case describes when a patient has received the second dose of  DTaP/Tdap/Td vaccine at 4 weeks that another dose should be forecast.

Evaluation_Test_Type: Interval: At Absolute minimum
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on interval
General_Description: This test case describes when a patient has received the second dose of DTap/Tdap/Td vaccine at 4 weeks - 4 days that the dose should be considered valid and that another dose should be forecast.

Evaluation_Test_Type: Interval: Below Absolute Minimum
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on interval
General_Description: This test case describes when a patient has received the second dose of DTaP/Tdap/Td vaccine at 4 weeks - 5 days that the dose should not be considered to be valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

Evaluation_Test_Type: All Valid: Forecast Test
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on interval
General_Description: This test case describes when a patient has received the third dose of DTaP/Tdap/Td vaccine at 6 months that the dose is considered to be valid.  Forecast another dose.

Evaluation_Test_Type: All Valid: Forecast Test
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on interval
General_Description: This test case describes when a patient has received the third dose of DTaP/Tdap/Td vaccine at 6 months - 4 days that the dose is considered to be valid.  Forecast another dose.

Evaluation_Test_Type: All Valid: Forecast Test
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on interval
General_Description: This test case describes when a patient has received the third dose of DTaP/Tdap/Td vaccine at 6 months - 5 days that the dose is not valid.  Forecast a repeat dose.

Evaluation_Test_Type: No Doses Administered
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on age
General_Description: This test case describes when assessing a newborn for the first dose of the Influenza vaccine that it should be administered at the recommended age of 6 months.

Evaluation_Test_Type: Interval: At Minimum
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on seasonal start date
General_Description: This test case describes when a newborn receives the first dose of the Influenza vaccine at 6 months and a second dose at 28 days later that the next dose of influenza is recommended at the next seasonal flu begin date.

Evaluation_Test_Type: All Valid: Forecast Test
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on interval
General_Description: This test case describes when a child under the age of 9 receives dose 1 of the influenza vaccine in his first season, that a second dose is recommended at 4 weeks later.

Evaluation_Test_Type: All Valid: Forecast Test
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on interval
General_Description: This test case describes when a child under the age of 9 receives only one influenza dose in his first season, that a second dose is recommended at 4 weeks later.

Evaluation_Test_Type: All Valid: Forecast Test
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on seasonal start date
General_Description: This test case describes when a child under 9 years of age receives two doses of the Influenza vaccine in his first season, that no additional doses are needed during that season.

Evaluation_Test_Type: Age: Below Absolute Minimum
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on age
General_Description: This test case describes when a child receives his first dose of the influenza vaccine before the age of 6 months, that the dose is not valid and should be repeated at the recommended age.

Evaluation_Test_Type: Age: At Absolute Minimum
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on interval
General_Description: This test case describes when a child receives his first dose of the influenza vaccine at 6 months - 4 days, that the dose is considered to be valid, and the next dose should be forecasted.

Evaluation_Test_Type: Age: At Minimum
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on interval
General_Description: This test case describes when a child receives his first dose of the Influenza vaccine at 6 months of age, that the dose is considered to be valid, and the second dose should be forecasted.

Evaluation_Test_Type: Interval: Below Absolute Minimum
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on minimum interval from invalid dose
General_Description: This test case describes when a child receives the second dose of the Influenza vaccine at less than 4 weeks - 4 days from the previous dose, that the dose is not valid and a repeat dose should be recommended at 4 weeks later.

Evaluation_Test_Type: Interval: At Absolute Minimum
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on seasonal start date
General_Description: This test case describes when a child receives the second dose of the influenza vaccine 24 days after the first dose, that the dose is considered to be valid.

Evaluation_Test_Type: Interval: At Minimum
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on interval
General_Description: This test case describes when a child under 9 years of age received one dose of the Influenza vaccine in a previous season and one in the current season that an additional dose is recommended in the current season. Forecast second dose at 4 weeks later.

Evaluation_Test_Type: No Doses Administered
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on age
General_Description: This test case describes when a patient is 9 years or older and does not have a current seasonal dose that a dose should be forecast.

Evaluation_Test_Type: All Valid: Forecast Test
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on seasonal start date
General_Description: This test case describes when a patient is 9 years or older and has been administered a dose of the flu vacccine in the current season that no additional doses should be forecast for the season.

Evaluation_Test_Type: All Valid: Forecast Test
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on seasonal start date
General_Description: This test case describes when a child under 9 years of age receives a flu vaccine in the current season and two vaccine doses in previous different season, that the series is complete for the season.

Evaluation_Test_Type: All Valid: Forecast Test
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on seasonal start date
General_Description: This test case describes when a child age 9 receives his first dose of the Flu vaccine that no additional doses are needed.  Series is complete for season.

Evaluation_Test_Type: All Valid: Forecast Test
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on interval.
General_Description: This test case describes when a child enters the flu season at age 8 years, received their first dose, but is now 9 years old. Per 2019-20 ACIP flu recommendations, the patient needs a second dose.

Evaluation_Test_Type: No Doses Administered 
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on seasonal date
General_Description: This test case describes when an adult patient has not received any doses of the influenza vaccine, that a dose should be forecast.

Evaluation_Test_Type: All Valid: Forecast Test
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationNot Recommended: series complete
General_Description: This test case describes when an adult patient has received a dose of the  influenza vaccine, that no additional doses are needed. Series is complete for the season.

Evaluation_Test_Type: No Doses Administered
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationRecommended based on age
General_Description: This test case describes when assessing a newborn for the first dose of the 2-dose Hep A vaccine that it is not recommended until at least 12 months of age.

Evaluation_Test_Type: Interval: At Minimum
Forecast_Test_Type: EvaluationNot recommended: series complete
General_Description: This test case describes when the second dose of the 2 dose Hep A vaccine is administered at least 6 months after the first dose, that no additional doses are recommended and that the series is considered complete.
